denver.trainers¶

denver.trainers.language_model_trainer¶

class denver.trainers.language_model_trainer.LanguageModelTrainer(pretrain='babe')[source]¶

Bases: object

A class Language model trainer.

downdload_lm(urls)[source]¶

Download the pretrained language models.

fine_tuning_from_df(data_df, seed=42, num_workers=1, num_epochs=10, learning_rate=0.001, moms=[0.8, 0.7], batch_size=128, drop_mult=0.5)[source]¶

Fine-tuning language model with dataframe

Parameters

  • data_df (DataFrame) – A train Dataframe

  • seed (int) – The number of seed

  • num_wokers – The number of workers

  • num_epochs (int) – The number of epochs

  • learning_rate (float) – The learning rate

  • moms (Union[tuple, List[float]]) – The momentums

  • batch_size (int) – The batch size

  • drop_mult (float) – The dropout multiple

fine_tuning_from_folder(data_folder=None, lm_fns=None, seed=42, num_workers=1, num_epochs=10, learning_rate=0.01, exp_lr=0.0575, moms=0.8, 0.7, batch_size=48, drop_mult=0.5, pct=0.1)[source]¶

Fine-tuning language model with folder dataset for fine-tuning LM

Parameters

  • data_folder (Union[str, Path, None]) – the path to folder data

  • lm_fns (Union[List[str], List[Path], None]) – The path to save language model

  • seed (int) – The number of seed

  • num_wokers – The number of workers

  • num_epochs (int) – The number of epochs

  • learning_rate (float) – The learning rate

  • exp_lr (float) – The experiment learning rate for the best results

  • moms (Union[tuple, List[float]]) – The momentums

  • batch_size (int) – The batch size

  • drop_mult (float) – The dropout multiple

  • pct (float) – The ratio to split train and valid during when training

fine_tuning_from_wiki(lm_fns=None, lang='vi', seed=42, num_workers=1, num_epochs=10, learning_rate=0.001, moms=0.8, 0.7, batch_size=128, drop_mult=0.5, pct=0.1)[source]¶

Fine-tunning Language model with Wiki dataset based on AWD_LSTM architecture.

Parameters

  • lm_fns (Union[List[str], List[Path], None]) – The path to save language model

  • lang (str) – The name of the language, default=’vi

  • seed (int) – The number of seed

  • num_wokers – The number of workers

  • num_epochs (int) – The number of epochs

  • learning_rate (float) – The learning rate

  • moms (Union[tuple, List[float]]) – The momentums

  • batch_size (int) – The batch size

  • drop_mult (float) – The dropout multiple

  • pct (float) – The ratio to split train and valid during when training

get_wiki(path, lang, name)[source]¶

Wikipedia data download function

Parameters

  • path – Path to save the dataset.

  • lang – Language wikipedia. Example: vi, en,..

  • name – The directory name that stores the dataset.

split_wiki(path, lang, name)[source]¶

Split data into sub-files

Parameters

  • path – Path to save the dataset.

  • lang – Language wikipedia. Example: vi, en,..

  • name – The directory name that stores the dataset.

denver.trainers.trainer¶

class denver.trainers.trainer.ModelTrainer(learn=None, use_tensorboard=False)[source]¶

Bases: object

A class for Model trainer.

train(base_path=None, is_save_best_model=True, model_file=None, learning_rate=0.02, batch_size=128, num_epochs=15, monitor_test=False, verbose=True, skip_save_model=False, overwrite=False, **kwargs)[source]¶

Trains any learners.

Parameters

  • base_path (Union[str, Path, None]) – The path to model directory

  • is_save_best_model (bool) – If True save the best model, else save the final model

  • model_file (Optional[str]) – The file name to save the model

  • learning_rate (float) – Initial learning rate

  • batch_size (float) – Size of batches during training

  • num_epochs (int) – Number of epochs to train

  • monitor_test (bool) – If True, test data is evaluated at end of each epoch

  • verbose (bool) – If False, disable show report results

  • skip_save_model (bool) – If True, disables saving the model

  • overwrite (bool) – If True, overwrite the old file
